job_details.Functieomschrijving:
You will join the new Generative AI team in the Digital Service Platform at Vanderlande, where you'll shape the future of logistics by harnessing the power of AI. Your mission will be to architect and develop a scalable, agentic AI product suite designed to optimize service interactions, enhancing both the efficiency and profitability of Vanderlande's service business. Initially, you'll lead the architecture and development of a RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) agent, focusing on ADAPTO and predictive maintenance. You will use managed services (from Azure and Databricks) to quickly deliver a solution that can be validated and tested with key users and customers. The scope will soon expand to include agents focused on providing analysis of local operational data, generated from ADAPTO.
       You will leverage our existing data management platform, insights product and other services from Databricks and Azure to quickly deliver a solution that can be validated and tested with key users and customers. Further down the line, the focus will shift towards building a multi-agent system which will leverage global operational and corporate data and documents to provide simple conclusions on ADAPTO service tickets. This solution should be able to eventually scale towards providing proactive issue identification and resolution recommendations.
       Responsibilities:
          + Collaborate with a cross-functional team of experts to define, design, architect and build a generative AI framework that can be expanded and scaled towards an agentic AI solution.
          + Build backend services supporting a generative AI solution, initially focusing on RAG.
          + Collaborate with Data scientists and front-end engineers in developing effective contracts, APIs and services.
          + Design and implement microservices architecture leveraging Azure cloud and the Databricks platform.
          + Develop and maintain infrastructure as code (IaC) using Terraform.
          + Use Jira to track and manage development tasks and project progress.
          + Ensure that the developed software meets high quality standards by implementing unit, component, and integration tests. Qualifications
job_details.full_text:
Backend Developer

You will join the new Generative AI team in the Digital Service Platform at Vanderlande, where you'll shape the future of logistics by harnessing the power of AI. Your mission will be to architect and develop a scalable, agentic AI product suite designed to optimize service interactions, enhancing both the efficiency and profitability of Vanderlande's service business. Initially, you'll lead the architecture and development of a RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) agent, focusing on ADAPTO and predictive maintenance. You will use managed services (from Azure and Databricks) to quickly deliver a solution that can be validated and tested with key users and customers. The scope will soon expand to include agents focused on providing analysis of local operational data, generated from ADAPTO.
       You will leverage our existing data management platform, insights product and other services from Databricks and Azure to quickly deliver a solution that can be validated and tested with key users and customers. Further down the line, the focus will shift towards building a multi-agent system which will leverage global operational and corporate data and documents to provide simple conclusions on ADAPTO service tickets. This solution should be able to eventually scale towards providing proactive issue identification and resolution recommendations.
       Responsibilities:
          + Collaborate with a cross-functional team of experts to define, design, architect and build a generative AI framework that can be expanded and scaled towards an agentic AI solution.
          + Build backend services supporting a generative AI solution, initially focusing on RAG.
          + Collaborate with Data scientists and front-end engineers in developing effective contracts, APIs and services.
          + Design and implement microservices architecture leveraging Azure cloud and the Databricks platform.
          + Develop and maintain infrastructure as code (IaC) using Terraform.
          + Use Jira to track and manage development tasks and project progress.
          + Ensure that the developed software meets high quality standards by implementing unit, component, and integration tests. Qualifications

analysis.rationale: The job description heavily emphasizes building agentic AI products, specifically RAG systems, and developing backend services to support generative AI solutions. The core responsibilities align with designing, developing, and deploying applications built on generative models, which is the hallmark of a GenAI Engineer.

job_tasks.phrase: shape the future of logistics by harnessing the power of AI
job_tasks.justification: This phrase indicates understanding the business context (logistics) and how AI can be applied to achieve business goals.

job_tasks.phrase: architect and develop a scalable, agentic AI product suite designed to optimize service interactions, enhancing both the efficiency and profitability of Vanderlande's service business
job_tasks.justification: This describes the business objective and the desired outcome of the AI product suite, linking technical development to business value (efficiency, profitability).

job_tasks.phrase: architect and develop a RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) agent
job_tasks.justification: RAG is a specific technique for generative AI models, indicating direct work on adapting or building generative models.

While 'predictive' can sometimes lean towards ML Engineer, in the context of a GenAI team and RAG, it implies using generative capabilities to inform or assist in predictive tasks, or using generative models to analyze predictive outputs.

job_tasks.phrase: leverage our existing data management platform, insights product and other services from Databricks and Azure
job_tasks.justification: This implies interacting with and utilizing existing data infrastructure and services, which is part of data engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: agents focused on providing analysis of local operational data, generated from ADAPTO
job_tasks.justification: Developing agents that provide analysis using generated data points to generative modeling tasks.

job_tasks.phrase: building a multi-agent system which will leverage global operational and corporate data and documents to provide simple conclusions on ADAPTO service tickets
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly mentions building a multi-agent system, a core component of advanced GenAI applications.

job_tasks.phrase: providing proactive issue identification and resolution recommendations
job_tasks.justification: This describes an outcome of an AI system that involves analysis and recommendations, fitting within the scope of generative AI applications.

job_tasks.phrase: Collaborate with a cross-functional team of experts to define, design, architect and build a generative AI framework that can be expanded and scaled towards an agentic AI solution
job_tasks.justification: This involves the design and architecture of a framework for AI solutions, which is a software development task.

job_tasks.phrase: Build backend services supporting a generative AI solution, initially focusing on RAG
job_tasks.justification: This is a direct software development task focused on building the infrastructure for a generative AI solution.

job_tasks.phrase: Collaborate with Data scientists and front-end engineers in developing effective contracts, APIs and services
job_tasks.justification: This involves defining interfaces and services, a key aspect of software development and integration.

job_tasks.phrase: Design and implement microservices architecture leveraging Azure cloud and the Databricks platform
job_tasks.justification: Designing and implementing microservices is a core software engineering activity.

job_tasks.phrase: Develop and maintain infrastructure as code (IaC) using Terraform
job_tasks.justification: Infrastructure as Code (IaC) is a fundamental practice in MLOps for managing and deploying infrastructure.

job_tasks.phrase: Use Jira to track and manage development tasks and project progress
job_tasks.justification: Project management tools like Jira are used in software development workflows.

job_tasks.phrase: Ensure that the developed software meets high quality standards by implementing unit, component, and integration tests
job_tasks.justification: Implementing various levels of testing is a standard software development practice to ensure quality.

technologies.justification: RAG is a technique often implemented using specific frameworks and libraries.
A platform often used for data engineering and ML, but here specified as a service leveraged.
A tool for Infrastructure as Code.
While Jira is a project management tool, in this context, it's used to manage development tasks within the AI project, fitting broadly with the development lifecycle tools.

soft_skills.phrase: Collaborate with a cross-functional team of experts
soft_skills.justification: Explicit mention of collaboration with diverse teams.
Indicates a proactive and problem-solving approach to building solutions.
Suggests taking initiative and ownership of key architectural decisions and development.

soft_skills.phrase: quickly deliver a solution that can be validated and tested
soft_skills.justification: Focus on delivering validated solutions efficiently implies a pragmatic approach.
